problems.title: Making a Large Island (Union Find)
problems.description:
You are given an n x n binary matrix grid. You are allowed to change at most one 0 to be 1.

Return the size of the largest island in grid after applying this operation.

An island is a 4-directionally connected group of 1s.

Input Format:
First line contains an integer n (size of grid).
Next n lines contain n space-separated integers (0 or 1) representing the grid.

Output Format:
Print a single integer representing the size of the largest island after changing at most one 0 to 1.
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
2
1 0
0 1

Sample Output 1
3

Explanation:
Change one 0 to 1 and connect two 1s, then we get an island with area = 3.

Sample Input 2
2
1 1
1 0

Sample Output 2
4

Explanation:
Change the 0 to 1 and make the island bigger, only one island with area = 4.

Sample Input 3
2
1 1
1 1

Sample Output 3
4

Explanation:
Can't change any 0 to 1, only one island with area = 4.
